alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ditto Branch, Finney Branch, Boothe Creek, Coles Creek, Big Chestnut Creek, Crab Creek, Blackwater River, Doe Run, Beaver Creek and Dinner Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount... Sydnorsville... Ferrum... Sontag... Oak Level... Callaway... Snow Creek... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
